intro: Lightfootia elegans, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Lightfootia elegans is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
